claim.text: CQCC features significantly outperform MFCC in classifying neurodegenerative disorders using Random Forest and SVM classifiers
claim.exact_quote: Our results demonstrate that CQCC, when integrated with Random Forest and Support Vector Machine classifiers, significantly outperform MFCC, achieving absolute improvements of 5.6 % and 7.7 %, respectively.

evidence.evidence_text: CQCC outperforms MFCC with 5.6% and 7.7% higher accuracy on RF and SVM classifiers
evidence.exact_quote: the proposed CQCC features outperform the baseline MFCC features with an absolute increment of 5.6% and 7.7% on RF and SVM classifiers, respectively

conclusion.limitations: Limited to specific datasets and conditions tested; performance differences vary between classifiers

claim.text: This is the first study to use sustained vowel sounds for multi neurodegenerative disorder classification and analysis
claim.exact_quote: To the best of the authors' knowledge, this is the first study of it;s kind on sustained vowel sounds for multi neurodegenerative disorder classification and analysis.

evidence.evidence_text: No direct evidence supporting this being first study - only unsupported claim
evidence.limitations: Only appears as an unsupported statement
evidence.exact_quote: To the best of the authors' knowledge, this is the first study of it;s kind on sustained vowel sounds for multi neurodegenerative disorder classification and analysis

conclusion.limitations: No systematic literature review provided; claim of novelty not substantiated

claim.text: CQCC achieved highest classification accuracy of 99% with Random Forest classifier for binary classification
claim.exact_quote: Among the features analyzed, CQCC achieved the highest classification accuracy, with the Random Forest classifier attaining an exceptional 99%, in contrast to the 63.4% accuracy achieved by the Support Vector Machine classifier.

evidence.evidence_text: CQCC achieved 99% accuracy with RF for binary classification
evidence.exact_quote: CQCC achieved the highest classification accuracy, with the Random Forest classifier attaining an exceptional 99%

conclusion.limitations: Limited to binary classification only; specific to dataset used

claim.text: CQCC features provide better class separation compared to MFCC features based on LDA analysis
claim.exact_quote: the LDA plot of CQCC features exhibits a clearer separation, especially between the ALS and Parkinson's disease classes...This stronger discriminative power indicates that CQCC features are more effective at distinguishing between neurodegenerative disorders and healthy individuals, making them a more robust feature set for classification tasks.

evidence.evidence_text: LDA plots show clearer separation between classes for CQCC vs MFCC
evidence.exact_quote: the LDA plot of CQCC features exhibits a clearer separation, especially between the ALS and Parkinson's disease classes

conclusion.limitations: Visual analysis of LDA plots is somewhat subjective; quantitative metrics for separation not provided

claim.text: CQCC provides superior spectrotemporal resolution for capturing fundamental frequency and harmonics in speech signals
claim.exact_quote: Constant Q Cepstral Coefficients (CQCC), which leverage geometrically spaced frequency bins to provide superior spectrotemporal resolution, particularly for capturing the fundamental frequency and its harmonics in speech signals associated with neurodegenerative disorders.

evidence.evidence_text: No direct experimental evidence comparing spectrotemporal resolution capabilities
evidence.limitations: Claim made without supporting experimental data

conclusion.limitations: Theoretical claim without direct experimental validation or comparative analysis
